6sOU9TNzkV5Lxp1iQh0dzw.text: Spaghetti spaghetti spaghetti.  LOVE this word.  And this place owns it!I visited several times and their many options of spaghetti always fills my crave well.I tried their Lobster bisque (soup) spaghetti, Hokkaido cheese cream spaghetti with Scallop,corn, potato, and also their Salmon spaghetti.  I prefer the soup style coz they really pour a lot of sauce and   that makes it delicious until the last spoon.  They are quite generous with the meat (yay!)And the service is quite fast too.Beside that, tried Matcha latte - OH my,,,, very rich green tea flavor!  Love it to the max, tho I wish they could serve it in a larger cup, ehe~  Worth a visit, especially if you're a pasta lover.And if you are not, you might want to put a new taste to your tongue & tummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Yomenya Goemon - Singapore, Singapore. "Bisque" Soup Spaghetti with Lobster

vs5BtruhO2AsoLnwy86MnA.text: Yomenya Goemon combines my two most favourite cuisine into a single dish! What's not the love!?!?They have many to choose from but my absolute favourite has to be their Mediterranean Seafood Spaghetti! It's creamy with tomato base in it so again, another combination of both my favourite italian sauces, full of fresh seafood! I'm salivating just writing about this! My friends ordered other pastas and I've tried them. They are nice enough but nothing beats my Mediterranean Seafood Spaghetti.They serve their pasta with a side of salad that is dressed in their own special tangy yet refreshing sauce. Very appetising indeed. I am definitely a fan!

YLlPHqlppbmNpJl3Ls59og.text: Interesting concept (fusion Japanese pasta) with delicious food. I liked the wasabi and shabu=shabu pastas.Great and fast service!

2mU84d9j8MdD7UGEMApzPA.text: 3.5 stars reviewCame here on a Sunday evening and was thinking that it will be crowded from the church service but was wrong.Got us seated pretty fast and was the first customer even though we arrived around 5.45pm. Instead of looking at the normal menu, I decided to go for their special menu - lobster bisque spaghetti.Service wasn't really great here even though there were quite a number of staffs and was seated at the worse corner (I had to fight against the glass wall while consuming my dish). Had a hard time talking to my ex-tutor and her husband too due to the constraint from the seating area.Food came around 10 minutes after we ordered. Decided to go Ala Carte for each one of us. The color of my dish was of bright dark orange which looked appetizing at first glance (I do look at food colors too when choosing food). Took a picture before digging in.Was given three small pieces of lobster meats. Love the sauce as it was flavorful. Besides that, the spaghetti was pretty soft. Safe to say that I picked the right food :) Food wise, I will give a 4 star for the lobster bisque spaghetti.Overall, will be back here with a smaller group of people (not 6) so that I can get a better seating arrangement. Will probably try out other "limited edition" food choices the next round.

photos.caption: Photo of Yomenya Goemon - Singapore, Singapore. Lobster bisque :)

-6j-CzaItwkxeziK0lwmvA.text: I don't eat ramenso we went to 'ghetti gomen.only bowls of noodlesI thought - what a doodle.a huge menu,surely something for you?I got the pork-sesamewhich suited me a T.it came plainly beigenot really quite the rage;it got me worrieduntil I stirred it -silky strandsperfectly al dente,strewn with boiled pork andvery filling for midday.the lunch sets do goodwith drink and salad and soup,the service a little strainedbut not enough to complain;the squid ink and yakitorialso went down agreeably:rather worth a return,if you fancy japanese-western.p.s. decent food, reasonable prices.

tvCPDmeq6AdFwOuf_6ceqA.text: They serve Japanese style spaghetti. It's rather ordinary food, given the price. I'd give it a miss.

gE5ZE8_yPiQz29alHWkL8Q.text: Great pasta choices. A little expensive but some dishes are worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Yomenya Goemon - Singapore, Singapore. Carbonara Meat Sauce with Onsen Egg

4lbOb4vxGMn-2n52jWfgDg.text: Had the Carbonara Meat Sauce with Onsen Egg while my companion did the Chicken & Mushroom with Porcini (isn't porcini a mushroom already?). Edible food. Not really worth the time. Kudos to the Vietnamese(?) waitress who waited on our table though. Her English isn't good but her enthusiasm more than makes up for it!

E7G-z2pqdY3gpLDjm0Metg.text: A travesty to food in general. The creamy pastas are especially terrible; extremely watery and tasteless with about 7 striplets of pork. Pastas from hawker centre western food stalls at about quarter the price would put this rendition to shame. The better pastas such as those with roe are average at best. The fact that the spaghetti itself is tasteless shows that they have no clue what they are doing.

jkWySZz5OoNVVzE05L4euQ.text: I would give it 3.5 stars if I could. This place, like all the other branches, serves decent al dente pasta. The pasta sauces are pretty good, but there are some that are much better than others. The carbonara with meat sauce and onsen egg is my favorite so far. Other than that, the rest of the cream sauces were a little one-note to me. The avocado oil sauce and mentai sauce were pretty good, just not very note-worthy. A good place to go if you are craving pasta.
